revised_title: Nonlinear Viscoelastic Tube Deformations and Polypropylene Applications
tldr: The authors developed a theoretical framework for the deformation of a thin-walled tube made of an isotropic nonlinear viscoelastic material. They applied this theory to experimental results obtained with a polypropylene tube, demonstrating how stress dependence of the material response functions can be examined systematically by varying independently the two stress invariants involved.
